meanings.definition: To offer a lower price than someone else in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: She always underbids her competitors to win the contract.
meanings.sent2: In auctions, it is common for bidders to underbids to get a good deal.
meanings.sent3: The savvy shopper underbids the market to get the best prices.
meanings.sent4: His strategy of underbidding the competition paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: Underbidding in business can sometimes lead to long-term success.

meanings.definition: To make a bid that is lower than the actual value or cost of something.
meanings.sent1: He underbids on rare items, hoping to snag a bargain.
meanings.sent2: The investor underbids on stocks to maximize profits.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally underbids on the antique vase, thinking it was a replica.
meanings.sent4: Underbidding on quality can sometimes result in poor purchases.
meanings.sent5: Underbidding may seem like a good idea, but it can have consequences.
